newsitem.title: USA: March U.S. aluminum shipments up 7.1 pct over Feb.
newsitem.headline: March U.S. aluminum shipments up 7.1 pct over Feb.

text.p: Total primary aluminum shipments in the U.S. in March, including exports, rose 7.1 percent to an estimated 1.898 billion lbs (860,919 tonnes) from February's revised total, Aluminum Association said.
Shipments were 3.8 percent above the March 1996 tally.
U.S. exports of aluminum ingot and mill products were reported at 249 million lbs during March, up 8.7 percent from the previous year's total of 229 million lbs.
Imports, totaling 637 million lbs, jumped 28.6 percent year on year.
Domestic shipments in March, including imports, rose 3.1 percent to 1.648 billion lbs over March 1996.
Year to date, domestic shipments rose 5.5 percent to 4.792 billion lbs, and domestic shipments in March rose 7.4 percent from February's level.
In April, the Association's order index rose 7.07 points to a total of 104.41 points, up from 97.34 points in March. Compared with April 1996, industry orders rose 13.36 points.
